definition: (of a plant) to be in bud
to keep/to contain/to suck (keep in your mouth without chewing)

sentences.english: You just have to see that it's wrapped in beauty and hidden away between the seconds of your life.
sentences.chinese: 你曾看到它的美含苞欲放，藏在你生命的瞬间里。

sentences.english: Gather ye rose-buds while you may.
sentences.chinese: 采摘含苞的玫瑰要得趁早。

sentences.english: In this poem, the budding flower means youth.
sentences.chinese: 在这首诗中，含苞待放的花朵象征着青春。

sentences.english: The flowers bud will weather the attacks from cold wind and rain, making it way blossom into the fair spring.
sentences.chinese: 让含苞的花蕾经受住寒风冷雨，绽放在明媚的春天。

sentences.english: When flowers have budded , spring is just round the corner.
sentences.chinese: 当花儿含苞欲放时，春天也就随之而来了。

sentences.english: There were red bursting flower buds hanging on the fresh apple tree branches.
sentences.chinese: 在苹果树新的枝头挂满了红色的含苞待放的花蕾。

sentences.english: What are those small yellow and white flowers sprouting up on the lawn?
sentences.chinese: 在草坪上含苞欲放的那些黄色和白色的小花是花？

sentences.english: And, like unfolded flowers beneath the sea.
sentences.chinese: 仿佛海底待放的花蕾含苞。

sentences.english: The flowers are now in bud.
You just have to see that it's rapped in beauty and hidden away between the seconds of your life.
sentences.chinese: 你会看到它的美含苞欲放，藏在你生命的瞬间里。

sentences.english: Came to the spring bud huaguduo.
sentences.chinese: 春天来到了含苞欲放的花骨朵上。

sentences.english: It would not remain in bud in the eternal winter mist.
sentences.chinese: 在永生的冬雾里，它将不再含苞。

sentences.english: The roses are in bud early this year.
She was a girl in bloom…much like a round red, rosy apple.
sentences.chinese: 她含苞待放，就象一只红苹果。

definition: (of a woman, a flower etc) delicate colors
tender and beautiful/also written 嬌艷|娇艳
style of folk song popular in Gansu, Qinghai and Ningxia/CL:首[shou3]
fig. beautiful purples and brilliant reds (idiom); lit. beautiful flowers
